item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, April 7, 2025 at 6:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. After 'coding error' triggers firings, top NIH scientists called back to work (223 points | 128 comments)
2. Rsync replaced with openrsync on macOS Sequoia (250 points | 187 comments)
3. Glamorous Toolkit (107 points | 25 comments)
4. Bill to block OpenAI's for-profit conversion gets mysteriously gutted (110 points | 23 comments)
5. Capital Trades: Tracking Stock Market Transactions of Politicians (240 points | 88 comments)
6. We asked camera companies why their RAW formats are all different and confusing (64 points | 12 comments)
7. AI masters Minecraft: DeepMind program finds diamonds without being taught (12 points | 1 comment)
8. Open-Source Is Just That (60 points | 57 comments)
9. CDC's top laboratory on STDs is shut by Trump administration (52 points | 5 comments)
10. Dark Mirror Ideologies (21 points | 9 comments)
11. New Theoretical Research Trends in Cartography (2001) (23 points | 5 comments)
12. Journey to Optimize Cloudflare D1 Database Queries (36 points | 7 comments)
13. Why Lotus Domino? (2024) (66 points | 33 comments)
14. Standard Ebooks: liberated ebooks, carefully produced for the true book lover (1029 points | 212 comments)
15. Microcomputers – The First Wave: Responding to Altair (40 points | 2 comments)
16. Charging electric vehicles 5x faster in subfreezing temps (69 points | 41 comments)

18. Baby Steps into Genetic Programming (40 points | 12 comments)
19. Circuit breaker triggered in Japan for stock futures trading (168 points | 131 comments)
20. Reinventing Feathering for the Vectorian Era (40 points | 4 comments)

22. Use the Gemini API with OpenAI Fallback in TypeScript (35 points | 21 comments)
23. Serious issues in Llama 4 training. I Have Submitted My Resignation to GenAI" (20 points | 5 comments)
24. Anagram Word Game (18 points | 6 comments)
25. Data centers contain 90% crap data (109 points | 61 comments)
26. Eavesdropping on smartphone 13.56MHz NFC polling during screen wake-up/unlock (128 points | 25 comments)
27. AEgIS turns phone sensors into antimatter camera of unprecedented resolution (23 points | 4 comments)
28. The “S” in MCP Stands for Security (580 points | 153 comments)
29. Recent AI model progress feels mostly like bullshit (322 points | 269 comments)
30. Foundry (YC F24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
